Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I gained a much greater musical sense and am able to both sing music and listen to music in ways I thought impossible before.
I strengthened my ability to identify chords by ear and use moveable do solfege.
Circle of Fifths; Keyboard skills; Major and Minor solfege scales; sight rhythm; compound meter
I greatly improved my rhythmic and melodic dictation and sightreading skills in major and minor keys.
Singing movable Do, identifying simple chords and common progressions in major and minor mode.
The class is very fair, but it can be rather difficult. It feels hard to prepare for things as most of the material we can do is in class. Other than that, the class is great and very educational.

Strengths: Very engaging; involves singing; keyboard lab

Weaknesses: could provide more paper material to aid students with learning material
I found keyboard lab was difficult. I really appreciated that we went over all the material that would be on midterms and finals. We practiced in class.

Class participation was encouraged and it was an open and accepting environment. 
If there could have been more practice examples on Canvas that would have ben helpful.
Yes, the class is very beneficial to musicians and non-musicians alike.
If a student is interested in gaining a better ear and learning basic but essential musical tools, I would recommend this course.
Yes. A great way to improve musicianship. You can go as in depth as you want but you can also just do what is required of you and still get something out of the course.
Yes, your ear will improve and you will have a new perspective on pop music and classical music.

I would recommend this course, but with the caveat that the amount of time I put into this course, and keyboard lab specifically, was at least equal to the time I spent on my other full-credit classes. I came out of the class with a much better understanding of functional harmony, better sight singing skills, and an improved ear, so Id say that the class did its job. I took this class after having placed into 110 on the music theory track - because of this, the challenge of the course was likely greater than it wouldve been for someone with a stronger music theory background.
